intro: Preussiella gabonensis, commonly known as the Gabon sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
